files.content:
locals {
  name_prefix = "${var.project_name}-${var.environment}"

  az_count = min(2, length(data.aws_availability_zones.available.names))
  azs      = slice(data.aws_availability_zones.available.names, 0, local.az_count)

  public_subnet_cidrs  = slice(var.public_subnet_cidrs, 0, local.az_count)
  private_subnet_cidrs = slice(var.private_subnet_cidrs, 0, local.az_count)

  enable_dns = length(trimspace(var.domain_name)) > 0

  container_name = "app"

  ecr_repo_name = local.name_prefix
}

files.name: README.md
files.content:
# Terraform - Hello Tomcat (WAR) on ECS Fargate

This Terraform deploys the Java Servlet WAR (Tomcat container) as an **ECS Fargate** service behind an **Application Load Balancer**.

## What you must provide
- AWS credentials (env vars, profile, or SSO)
- A built container image pushed to the created ECR repo (or adapt to external image)

## Quick start
```bash
cd ai_tf
terraform init
terraform apply -var environment=dev
```

After apply, push an image to ECR:
```bash
aws ecr get-login-password --region us-east-1 | docker login --username AWS --password-stdin <account_id>.dkr.ecr.us-east-1.amazonaws.com

docker build -t hello-tomcat-dev .
docker tag hello-tomcat-dev:latest <repo_url>:latest
docker push <repo_url>:latest
```

Then force a new deployment:
```bash
aws ecs update-service --cluster <cluster> --service <service> --force-new-deployment
```

## HTTPS + DNS (optional)
Set:
- `domain_name`
- `hosted_zone_id`
- `enable_https = true`

Terraform will request an ACM certificate and create a Route53 alias record.
